newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish Izolacja sets IPO issue price at PLN 120.
newsitem.headline: Polish Izolacja sets IPO issue price at PLN 120.

text.p: Polish insulation materials firm Izolacja SA set the issue price of its initial public offering at 120 zlotys per share, the company said in a statement on Thursday.
Izolacja plans to enter the Warsaw bourse's main market and would be the first firm from Poland's mass privatisation National Investment Fund (NFI) scheme to gain a bourse listing.
The firm is offering 100,130 shares from December 9 to December 13, with 70,130 shares needed to be sold for the issue to be valid. Investors are allowed to register for up to 350 shares.
The firm's main shareholders are NFI No. 9, which holds 33 percent, and the state treasury, which holds 25.3 percent.
Izolacja, which specialises in making insulation for roofs for residential housing, made a net profit of 8.4 million zlotys last year on sales of 93.1 million zlotys.
